website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-use balance ball chair with casters that's adaptable to fit taller and heavier people.
pros: Uses a 52-centimeter exercise ball that's removable for easy inflation or use in a yoga class
Built to fit most standard sized desks
Works best for people between 5-foot and 5-foot 11
Allows for addition of two-inch extension for taller people
cons: Ball may not hold its inflation well over time

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a couple months ago and have loved it! I read through the reviews before purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a couple months ago and have loved it! I read through the reviews before purchasing and thought the front bracket/hardware issue had been resolved...I was wrong! Bolt snapped and the chair is now useless as the ball wont stay on the base without the front bracket.... I've looked for replacement parts and see nothing. I don't want to buy an entire base or completely new chair. Frustrated to say the least
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rosborough

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable chair
customer_reviews.text: First off, there are a lot of negative reviews of this chair and I think it's great! It's easy to assemble (if you pay attention to the directions). It's important to inflate, let it rest overnight, then re-inflate to get it to the correct size. I am 5'4" and I purchased the leg extenders because otherwise it was too short for my standard desk with keyboard drawer. I don't know why they say the leg extenders are for tall people, I couldn't get into a comfortable, ergonomic position without them. Also, it's a little "stuffy" sitting on the rubber all day in shorts, so I put a cloth cover over the ball. Voila! works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 7-8 months
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an exercise ball as an office chair for over 5 years. I didn't use the back piece, as it was so low down it didn't serve a purpose. The base was nice because it was more stable, but after about 7 months of use, the screw that's holding the metal piece in place broke in half. The actual SCREW BROKE. The metal piece was helping to keep the ball stable, so the chair feels like it's slowly falling apart. This product is the same price as a nice regular office chair, so I would expect the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Broken bar a week in
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about a week, the metal bar that wraps around the front of the ball has snapped on both ends. I took some pictures to illustrate this. It's still usable with the bar broken but theres a noticeable difference when trying to move the chair forward Also disappointing since I've only used the chair a week.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Chow

customer_reviews.title: Reduced low back pain and improved posture!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm loving this chair. Yoga ball takes the pressure off the coccyx and naturally reduces low back pain from sitting longer than your body cares to. Backrest, of course, allows you to lean back if you need to. It was super easy to assemble, the ball was easy to inflate with no issues with it being too small like some reviews have commented. If you are 5'7" or taller, I recommend purchasing the Giam Yoga Ball Chair leg extensions at the same time you purchase the chair or you might be frustrated with the low ride-- I'm 5'8" and super happy I did! Delighted with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: ReviewMama

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better Than My Old Office Chair
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this chair for about two weeks at work. My work requires that I sit at a computer all day. My old office chair looked like a nice one, but it left my bottom sore and my back aching at the end of the day. I have used a balance ball chair in past employment and liked it, so I bought one to use at this job. This is so much better! Besides dramatically reducing the pain in my bottom and back, it is helping tighten my stomach muscles, too. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Audio-Bookish

customer_reviews.title: Great when rarely used - now with WFH, the base cracked in 2 days. Im well under the weight limit
customer_reviews.text: This was a great chair when it was just setting in my rarely used home office - at most, it was used about 3 hours per week. I started using it when we were sent home in light of the Covid-19 pandemic, and it broke within 2 days. the base cracked, so its not something I can fix. the wheel will no longer stay in. and Yes, i'm well below the 300# weight limit for the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Elaine

customer_reviews.title: PURPLE BALL IS SMALLER
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely a ball size issue when purchasing through Amazon. I have included pictures of the PURPLE chair I bought here, versus the grey one my mom bought directly through Gaiam's website. So now I have to pay even more to make sure I get the correct size ball. Total scam. UPDATE - OF COURSE IT IS NOT ALLOWING ME TO POST THE COMPARISON PICTURES.
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: Not the sa chair, does not measure up
customer_reviews.text: On the right is my 5 yo chair. I order an identical chair and on the left is what arrived. NOT identical. Not near tall enough, even with the leg extensions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short person
customer_reviews.text: I am 5.0 tall and this works very well for me. I feel like I need to inflate it every week or so. That may be because I like to bounce on it. It's easy to inflate for my husband, but I think my small size makes it not so easy. I can usually sit on it most of the day, but I do sometimes get some lower back pain and have to sit in my other desk chair. All in all I love it and have no issues telling others to buy it. I kinda wished I bought the Pink or Purple Ball. But the black is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nova Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality of the product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work. The first time I used it, the bar that holds the ball in broke at the bolt. Then you had to be very careful when you moved not to get bucked out of it. I was taking care of a patient and next thing I knew I was on my back like a stuck turtle, legs in the air! The ball burst! I was told that after my back surgery, I need to strengthen my core and this will help with that as well as reducing pressure on my spine while sitting at work. Thank goodness I didn’t get hurt! Just embarrassed and very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Penny M.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised The box did not contain 55cm ball It is so small it falls through the chair.
customer_reviews.text: I have to edit my review after chatting with Amazon. They offerred return / replacement. I did not want to be bothered so they offered a partial refund so I can buy the right size ball. ..........So I am now very happy.//// The chair seems fine but the yoga ball included is not 55cm as described. The product description is a lie. The yoga ball is so small it falls through the chair. Why was the wrong sized ball ever placed in the box? It makes no sense. With the pandemic I am not going to return it but fork over and buy the correct size ball. Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Donna Clarke

customer_reviews.title: The ball is only about 15 inches in diameter, ...
customer_reviews.text: The ball is only about 15 inches in diameter, instead of the 52 cm which is about 20 inches in diameter. This is way too low for me to use at my desk. I need a replacement ball that is the larger size. So after working on this some more and adding a lot more air, I was able to get the ball large enough to use.
customer_reviews.author: Messier-Bugatti-Tracer M.

customer_reviews.title: So far not happy
customer_reviews.text: This is the second chair we ordered. I had such high hopes, the first chair was great. This one the ball is a 1/4 of the size even letting it deflate and adding more air. I sent the company a note....we'll see what they say. At best they replace the ball, but its still inconsistent product.
customer_reviews.author: Suddsyt

customer_reviews.title: Sized for a child!
customer_reviews.text: Caution - It is like a toddler chair! The description says good to those standing 5’ 11” and I’m much shorter and it is still way too short. The description and photos led me to believe I could use it at a desk and it’s not even right for a coffee table. I had 4 other adults in the height range try it and we all agree that it belongs in a Pre-K to young elementary age classroom. I would have given it 1 star, but to be fair, it was easy to inflate and a child might find it comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: While I like this chair
customer_reviews.text: While I like this chair, it seems there is no consistency in ball size. The ball that came with my chair was really small, and would've worked better if it would've been the larger ball. Going through the pictures posted by other customers I see some have the small size and others larger, so I'm not sure how to be sure which size you'll get. Edit: I read other reviews that said to try and blow the ball up more after a few days, that didn't work for me, but I tried again about a week later and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: For the first couple of weeks it did strain my lower back which I assumed is due to poor posture. But after that time it feels fine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair since I sit for 7 hours a day for work. For the first couple of weeks it did strain my lower back which I assumed is due to poor posture. But after that time it feels fine. You can also use it to do exercises when sitting on the ball in the chair or take ball out to do them. If you don't sit on it for awhile (like I did when I was off for 2 weeks vacation) and you go back to it, you feel like you're starting over because you feel it in your lower back.
customer_reviews.author: HI-DEF GUYS

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, but wheels lock during use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the chair to help with hip pain due to sitting at the computer for 6-10 hours most days. It was easy for me to put together including blowing up the ball/seat. I find it to be it surprising comfortable although it has helped the hip pain only slightly. My one complaint is the wheels keep locking on their own during use and then I can't roll the chair properly until unlocking them again by hand.
customer_reviews.author: K. J.

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea but...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to strengthen my core will I sit and slowly die at my desk. Someone in my office had it and she loved it so I ordered. Unfortunately, for me it did not work out. While the chair is solid, a good height and good mobility, I found that my butt cheeks and "nether regions" were going numb (like that tingly "falling asleep" feeling) if I sat longer than 15-20 minutes -- that was a no-go for me. Works for some, not for others.
customer_reviews.author: Kiko

customer_reviews.title: Looks much bigger in picture
customer_reviews.text: This chair is definitely not meant for use at a regular office desk. At 5'2" while sitting on this chair fully inflated puts me at an awkward level reaching up to my keyboard and mouse. Now I have to buy the extenders and hope that they make a difference, I would go with the bigger 62cm ball, but read that it would not fit this "Classic" ball chair. UPDATE - Waiting the 24 hours after initial inflation, following instructions to fully inflate...this ball is equivalent to an office desk chair height. I no longer have any issues with reaching or over extending to my mouse or keyboard. I'm increasing my rating on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Alyse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size when inflated properly!
customer_reviews.text: First inflation made the chair too short for my desk but thankfully I re-read the instructions on Amazon because the inflation instructions with the chair were different. On Amazon it says to inflate ball and wait 24-hours then deflate 50% and fully inflate again. Perfect! Package arrived timely and chair was easy to set up. I did it in about 15 minutes. Oh and I’d recommend an electric pump if you have one because it takes less time.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya W

customer_reviews.title: Bar brace keeps breaking - chair useless
customer_reviews.text: Loved this chair because it does wonders for my back (and the other staff who have them like them too), BUT... if you're going to be up and down or moving while on it a lot - like you usually would do while working at a desk - DO NOT GET THIS CHAIR. the metal bar which holds the ball onto the frame at least lasts 6-8 months before snapping, but the cheap plastic replacement bars they send you only holds for 2-3 weeks before breaking. Then the ball doesn't want to stay on the frame. Very cheap and useless. We will be looking for different chairs for our office.
customer_reviews.author: Katie C.

customer_reviews.title: Leaking
customer_reviews.text: In less than two months, ball started leaking along a seam (manufacturing defect). I’m not a heavy person, male less than 200 lbs. Sent an email to the manufacturer (Gaiam) two weeks ago, no response.
customer_reviews.author: S.Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and love it, except...
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with this chair. I like the ability to roll around while sitting on the ball and that it doesn't just roll away when you stand up. A few cons to consider: - I strongly advise using a bike pump to inflate the ball. The hand pump that comes with it is basically useless. - I catch my heel on the caster lock about every 5 minutes and it is infuriating as I'm then stuck and have to bend to unlock it.
customer_reviews.author: JTrue

customer_reviews.title: Work great for kids.  Quality is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two for our son’s homeschooling stations; ages 7 and 11. No one has fallen off their chair. The plastic looks and feels a little cheap. My oldest son scratched his leg badly on a corner and didn’t realize until I pointed out the blood everywhere. Check all the corners and edges for defects! Install wasn’t super clear but luckily my wife had read about inflating the balls, waiting 24 hours, then inflating to full size. I occasionally catch both kids bouncing without realizing it as they work. I think it’s very helpful in helping them stay focused by burning off energy.
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair!
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived a day early (which is saying something on 2-day shipping)! It was easy to assemble and seems well constructed. Very simplistic. Came with a pump, wrench, instructions, and work-out poster. Took 10 minutes to build and inflate the ball. My wife took it to work as her office chair and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Moradth

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stable, perfect  for desk
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in 2 days. My family was unsure about my 61 yr old butt sitting on it. They were sure I would roll or fall off and break something. They wanted me to return it before even opening the box. I insisted open and assemble. Niece assembled it in 25 mjns. When it was done I asked her and her dad(my brother) sit on it, Niece was surprised at it's stability . Brother sat and said "Comfortable"! He was surprised at how soft it was "Oh thats different". I can do most of the exercises shown on the exercise sheet. My favorites are the leg,torso, and back ones while sitting at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Mattos

customer_reviews.title: Metal Bar Broke
customer_reviews.text: The ball worked great for a little over a year but the the metal bar broke. I wrote the company and they immediately sent a nylon replace which is flimsy and bendable. IT DOES NOT WORK. The ball continues to slip out of the base even though it's properly inflated. This is a safety issue which they are ignoring. The company says they no longer supply the metal bar even though the pictures in their ads still show it. If you are a young person trying to keep your core strong then you should be just fine. If you are an older person who needs to keep good posture, you should be very careful.
customer_reviews.author: Just For You

customer_reviews.title: It's too short
customer_reviews.text: If you are a midget or sit at a tiny desk this is great. I however sit at a normal human desk at my job so no one could f****** see me over my computer. I bought extenders. Made about an inch taller. I am 5'9 and wear tennis shoes to work. I could not figure out what to do with my legs. I am returning because I got sick and tired of my new co-workers making fun of me all day. So, I will continue to spend 8 hours in excruciating pain instead of looking like I'm the class parent for a kindergarten class.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome healthy living chair
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product/chair. It comes with the pump takes less than 10min to assemble and the two things that need to be secured you are provided a throw away wrench or they have grips to tighten. I love the book that gives you proper sitting posture/position and exercises on the chair as well as taking the ball from the chair. Great purchase and will recommend to co-workers for their desks.
customer_reviews.author: Nissa88

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chair for 7 weeks. It worked great for the first 5 weeks, then the Plastic around one of the front wheels broke apart and wouldn't allow the wheel to swivel. I purchased the wheel extenders, thinking that would fix the problem, but when I put them on, the wheel extension wouldn't stay in the chair. Every time I sat on it, the chair would fall and the extension would shoot across the floor. I loved the chair itself, I could really see a difference in my balance and core muscles, but the chair itself is made pretty cheaply. I think I will look for a similar one that is maybe made a little better.
customer_reviews.author: bunie

customer_reviews.title: secure and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Working from home has wrecked havoc on my back! This balance ball chair has helped tremendously. I automatically sit better when I'm on it. Feels very secure and comfortable. Follow the directions when inflating. Partial on day one to naturally let the ball stretch and then measure diameter the next day to know how much more to add. I found the need for a little more air after using it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't match the pictures
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this chair. I found it as a returned item, so I thought I would give it a chance. Unfortunately it was missing the plug to keep the ball inflated. It is possible the person who returned the product switched balls, but when I looked at the picture on the box it showed the ball sitting lower to the ground than in the picture on this site. Returning it was simple, so that is why I give this product 2 stars instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. M

customer_reviews.title: improved posture, seems durable
customer_reviews.text: This chair has significantly improved my posture already. I am a healthy sloucher... fit, but poor posture. I use this chair 4-6 hours a day at school (during remote learning, I'm on the Chromebook. I need to get a standing desk) I did get the extensions, which I recommend if you have long legs (otherwise, your knees are high, and hip flexor muscles get tight)
customer_reviews.author: Psalm 37:4-7

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait to inflate, your hips will thank you for this chair!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together with the ball inflation being the hardest part. It took me two days to finally have my ball expand fully. The material is significantly sturdier and thicker material than my other two yoga balls I have. After a week of active sitting, I have noticed that my hip pain is getting lesser day by day. I also found it helpful to release a bit of air from the ball for my own comfort. If you are already looking into what it takes to reduce your pain and have better posture, giving a couple extra days to "customize" your chair is well worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: TheFrugalFoodie

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Chair Back... OK Chair
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had the chair a few weeks- it’s fine. I use it just for sitting at my desk (not exercise). Why is there a back on it? You can’t lean far enough back to touch it with your back, and if you do, the chair becomes unstable and falls backward. I wish I’d just bought a stand/base without the back to it doesn’t take up as much room- or one that has a usable back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: The color is not as shown, ball too small, “back” is just a handle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in “fuchsia” which looks much deeper pink/purple online than in person. It’s really a rose pink in real life. Not what I wanted, but it’s too much of a pain to return it. Also somewhat surprised the ball is as small as it is. Yes, I followed instructions and re-inflated the ball after 24 hours. It’s still smaller than expected. Further disappointment in the “back” of the chair part. It’s not at all something you can lean on and is really only a handle for moving the unit around. I’ll keep it because, again, too much of a pain to return, and the ball itself is comfortable for sitting on. Not ideal for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: nuthin13357667

customer_reviews.title: High priced
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Easy assembly. Looks short, but was impressed that when sitting on it was good height for my desk. I did buy the leg extenders too just in case. With all the bad reviews of the item not holding up, we will have to see, but I am impressed so far. Everyone at the office was trying it out. My employees were worried it would slip out from them with no arm rests. The chair is made all of plastic with medal bar and screws. There's a ball pump too. It's light and rolls fine on tile floor. I felt the chair was high priced for the materials used with 20 shipping...
customer_reviews.author: Celestial Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just follow the instructions and you'll get a perfect chair
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ball-chair ever. I followed the instructions to inflate to a T. Some reviews on here clearly didn't follow the directions. Yes, you have to inflate the ball twice, the first time to capacity, which makes the ball seem much too small. But then the material stretches, and you inflate it the rest of the way. It ends up fitting perfectly. The height of the chair with the fully inflated ball is perfect for my desk. I've been using it off and on for a couple of days now and it's comfy, makes my back and shoulders feel better, my legs don't cramp up from sitting all day for work. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Smuckeroo

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've been sitting on this all day and no issues. Clearly, those people who are complaining about the ball not being big enough didn't read the directions. You have to fill the ball, let it stand for 24 hours, deflate 50%, then fill up desired height (just not past 22"). The ball will stretch even when it feels firm, so keep pumping! So far, so good here!
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: Loved the chair....BUT........Now; unfortunately, I miss the chair. The bar on the front broke off mine after less than 8 months in use. I am not having much luck in getting help or a response from anyone for a replacement bar. Someone please tell me how to easily resolve this issue!!!!! UPDATE: Customer service contacted me not once but TWICE! Got my bar, fixed my chair. All is well!
customer_reviews.author: Montgomerymom

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for the office
customer_reviews.text: I love having the option of a ball chair. I wish that the ball was bigger. I did swap out and now use a 65cm ball and it fits in there snugly. However, the wheels don't roll that great and keep locking. Wish it were a bit sturdier, but it does help me with my posture while i'm working at my desk all day. Also, the exercise poster is nice. At the end of the day, i lay on my back across the ball for about 5 breaths and then do the same laying across it on my belly. That feels great after an 8 hour day! I do that mid-day as well sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Factory defect
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try out this chair... But there was a factory defect and the threads for the knob to screaw into that connect the chair back tothe base was so far from being close there was no possible way we could make it work. And when trying to take the bar off to repack it... cheap materials. I will try tore order as I have a friend that has this same chair and it is amazingly comfortable. Which is why it doesn't have a 1 start rating. If the next chair can be assembled, I will retract my rating and leave a more favorable rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, decent ball
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year since I ordered this chair, and I use it frequently. I will admit I'm a bouncer, much to the annoyance of my video conference attendees. I love the chair, but I'm a bit disappointed that the ball thinned in one spot and developed a hole. It's not a huge problem, and honestly, my bouncing may be part of what caused it, but just be aware if you're a Tigger! Although, since it gives me the opportunity to replace the ball with one in a brighter color more to my taste, it's not all bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Kremer Elliott

customer_reviews.title: I'm just very confused about this new ball chair. ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm just very confused about this new ball chair. I had one for the last 3 years and did not have a problem with the height. Obviously I'm not shorter or taller but this chair is shorter. You sent me another chair but alas, it was the same (ball) height; Too short. I just sent back the second chair and decided to just order the height extenders for the wheels to attach to. Whatever the reason for the size change or difference, I still appreciate the quality and the impact this chair has on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hm, what to say...
customer_reviews.text: This was MUCH shorter than I was expecting. That being said... I am 5'5'' and it puts my knees at exactly a 90 degree angle with my feet flat on the floor. It's more stable than just sitting on a ball which is nice for longer time frames. The problem I have is that the shortness of the chair means I'm reaching up to type on my keyboard which is terrible for neck, shoulder, and upper-back posture. I'm still in the market for the perfect ball chair but this one is working in the interim and may work well for you have you have an adjustable height desk.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Work from Home!!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and sitting too long in my ergonomic desk chair would make my back and hips ache. When I would use my standing desk adjuster and work from a standing position, it would be great for awhile, but my knees would ache. When I ordered this, it comes with the small ball, I didn’t think I would be able to use it. However, all I had to do was lift the small ball off the base and put a large stability ball of the chair. I use it everyday. It keeps my back and hips from aching. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K Smith

customer_reviews.title: Active sitting ...... not for the lounger.
customer_reviews.text: It's been quite a while since I've had to sit at a desk for long periods of time. I thought this chair would provide some type of caloric burn for me, not for the purpose of losing weight, more so to keep the blood flowing and provide an opportunity for some active movement while working. My only complaint is that one of the knobs used to secure the back of the chair was broken. I'm still able to use it, I just need a large screw driver to tighten it. I was hoping to get a replacement, but I would have to return the complete order to receive one bad piece. I deducted a star because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Creative One

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic of chair pushes ball up and causes leg to fall asleep
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the hype. This is not comfortable. An exercise ball with a $10-15 holder works better and is more comfortable and stable! The chair and parts that hold the ball cause the soft ball for have pressure points in very uncomfortable areas. My leg fell asleep in less than an hour of use. Do your body and legs a favor and do not buy this. Get an exercise ball and a ball base for half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: This chair was amazing! For two weeks. The air started leaking out of the ball without cause. I called Gaiam and they were amazingly responsive and sent me a replacement ball. I've only had it one day but I appreciated the level of service I received. Companies like this aren't common these days.
customer_reviews.author: HappyHiker

customer_reviews.title: Not just for fitness buffs!
customer_reviews.text: I followed instructions to allow the rubber to "stretch" after the initial inflation. I love the color and this is the perfect height for my school desk. I've had surgery on my back and have a rather flat bottom. These two challenges left me a bit hesitant to purchase this chair but I LOVE it! This an excellent option for those extended sessions on the computer. My bottom doesn't get tired from the lack of cushioning and surprisingly, this set up is less fatiguing than regular office chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Ball is defective
customer_reviews.text: After less than six months, I needed to start pumping up this chair after every two hours of sitting. It is very frustrating and it causes wrist and back discomfort as it deflates. I have had one of these chairs from a competitor at work for years and have only pumped it up a couple of times. I purchased the name brand for my home office when I needed to work from home assuming it would be the superior product - I was mistaken.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Got Child's Bounce Ball
customer_reviews.text: I arrived without the 52" Bounce Ball as describe. Instead, I received a child's Bounce Ball that is two sizes too small for the chair. Decided it would be too much trouble to get replacement so I just bought another one. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Easy To Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy enough. The instructions were easy to follow. I mistakenly put one of the locking casters in the front, though. Pulling it off was a real bear! After trying out the chair at the standard height, I now want to install the 2" extenders I ordered with it. I'm guessing that getting all four casters off is going to really be a challenge. I ordered a pump for $6 because I didn't read the description well enough. The chair comes with a nice pump so my $6 pump goes on the shelf with it. The little folded guide that comes with the chair is easy to read and it's well illustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Baird

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: This ball and chair were cheap and I had to send it back. First of all, I couldn't put it together, because one of the holes where the silver metal bar goes across didn't line up or wasn't big enough on one side so I couldn't put the bar on the platform. In my opinion, the overall look was too cheap and after I couldn't put it together (again, not by my error), I gave up and just sent it back. Quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: RBJ

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I use this chair as my 'sewing chair'. It is comfy and helps ease pressure on my back (I sit there for hours). It was a little low so I ordered the extenders and now it's the perfect height for me. I would go ahead and order the extenders at the same time as ordering the chair because tho installing them is easy, getting the wheels off to put the extenders on was a little bit of a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's the most comfortable office chair I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is my second ball chair! I have one at home. I recently got a job where I work in the office and not at home. I didn't want to take my ball chair from home in case I need it there, so I bought another one for my office! So comfy! It's the most comfortable office chair I've ever had. I've had chairs of all kinds over the years, and this one is my favorite. My butt doesn't hurt at the end of the day. And the back lets you rest your back when you do get tired, because we all get tired of sitting straight up all day.
customer_reviews.author: Bekah

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of use it seems like I have to inflate more often but I love this chair!! Everyone in my office thought I was weird but it is so much more comfortable and doesn't give you that it's-3pm-and-I-need-6-more-cups-of-coffee feeling lol Builds a bit of core strength naturally but if you are anywhere near 5' in height consider the footrest too! And the extender feet if you work at a desk that isn't adjustable. There are some cool rollerblade-style wheel accessories you can get for this too check it!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one- and it's not as good as the first one
customer_reviews.text: Updated review. I have removed my 5 star rating and moved it to three. I like the design. Soo much that this is my second one. However. The casters (mainly the locking ones) are absolutely horrible. The will not stay unlocked. I have tried rigging it with a rubber band to hold the the lever up- and it doens't work. This is highly frustrating when it comes to getting up and down. I would look at another manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Krysie

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'2'' and this chair is perfect for me, my feet actually touch the floor! I bought this because in my third trimester my regular office chair was putting too much pressure on my hips, and this helps so much! It also helps my lower back. It is way more comfortable to sit on than my regular office chair. I was worried it would be too short for me to work at my desk but I haven't had any issues so far. The only negative I have is that the wheels don't roll quite as well as I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my home office since I sit a lot for work and have issues with my hips. I think this chair has helped with that a lot. It was easy to set up; instructions are provided: fill the ball and after 24 hours deflate 50%, then reinflate and the ball will get larger. I completed that just for purposes of following the manufactures directions but I don't think I needed the ball to be much bigger than I inflated it to on day one either way.
customer_reviews.author: MLR

customer_reviews.title: Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I ordered 2 one with a blue ball and one with a black ball. Now that we're homeschooling due to coronavirus we're sitting around the table a lot doing school work and zoom classes. Best purchase ever it keeps your posture strong, while still allowing you to move a bit if you're a figity person like myself and my son. It's also become my sons gaming chair which means he's no longer hunched over, so thank you. The only negative thing I have noticed which isn't really all that bad is the I bought two separate chairs each a different color and the blue ball is smaller than the black ball(noticeably). Though that fault worked out well for us.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and potentially dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in August and most recently, the resistance band snapped and hit my girlfriends daughter in the arm and stomach as well as my neck. It could have been much much worse. I absolutely had the bands secured properly to a cemented pole. But the band itself literally snapped like a broken rubber and. Besides that, the pump is a bit cheap and hard to use and the ball loses air gradually so you have to inflate periodically. Probably happens with most balance balls but still worth noting. I would perhaps research other brands that are more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Bird..

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than pictured, caused sciatica pain
customer_reviews.text: The model I received had about a 40% smaller ball than the one pictured. I sat on it for about two weeks and tried to make it work, but i think it was just too short for my height (I'm 5'6") and I started getting sciatica pain so this was not a good purchase for me. Another guy in the office got the same one and it was also smaller than pictured, but he's loving it because he's only 5'2".
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my desk at work - very happy with it. Consistent use has reduced by neck/shoulder/lower back pain. The first few days I had some ab soreness- not terrible but it felt like I did some serious oblique exercises. Definitely not unpleasant, but more tha I expected. I have had to reinflate the ball only once so far.
customer_reviews.author: MommaMia

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this chair!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice seat for my wiggly 6yo. Its a bit "sticky" so he doesn't slide around but being able to bounce helps keep his attention focused on school instead of sliding around in a chair. We bought the legs for it vs the wheels and are very happy with them! Follow the directions with the ball and it inflates great the second time.
customer_reviews.author: Teysha

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: The metal bar broke after three months of daily use. Quality of the balance ball isn't great, requires frequent inflation. Just as expected for the price (paid around $65). I was thinking about the purchase of a good quality balance ball to replace, but the chair is no longer safe. I suggest not to sit on the chair with the broken metal bar. The balance ball pops out of the frame and you will go with the ball. It might be ok to use the chair occasionally as a back-up office chair.
customer_reviews.author: KYH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for the standard office chair
customer_reviews.text: I started a job that has me sitting most of the day and am unable to use a standing desk and I found myself slumping in the rolling chair. I brought my stability ball to sit on but couldn't move around my office or reach things easily which hindered me. This was the perfect answer. I sit up straight, can move easily, and have avoided a sore back. It was easy to put together and inflate and rolls effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beans

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This ball chair is great for back issues and stability! It works well and the only issue with this chair is that the wheel locks fall down occasionally and you cannot roll, you have to be aware of the locks but otherwise it is a very stable and comfortable chair for daily office use
customer_reviews.author: ralfie

customer_reviews.title: Meh...it's ok...I'd spend a little more money on a better quality one
customer_reviews.text: Meh...yeah...it's a bouncy ball chair thing for exercise...ok we get it...they're trying to be trending with the exercise thing. Overall it's not very good materials. They could have put a little more money into the back rest. I used it for a while but it just wasn't good enough quality for me to want to continue sitting on it. Every now and then if I'm sitting for a long period of time and feel like switching it up to something different I'll pull it out and sit on it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zablocki

customer_reviews.title: Great for back issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair due to arthritis in my low back and sitting all day at work has gotten increasingly painful. This chair offers great relief as it relieves the pressure from a regular office chair while sitting. It came with exercises which can be easily done in the chair. I perform these exercises several times a day and my back feels so much better. I would definitely recommend this chair to not only people with back issues, but anyone who sits a lot through out the day.
customer_reviews.author: Trina A

customer_reviews.title: Ball Chair
customer_reviews.text: all i wanna say is that if you are experiencing back pain wanna help yourself by having better posture? then this is the Chair for you. there are so many exercise you can do with this chair while sitting on it. you will enjoy this chair
customer_reviews.author: carmen roldan

customer_reviews.title: Ball will not hold air after 1 month of use.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this ball. I purchased April 21, 2018 (and the window to return was May 21, 2018). Today is June 2, 2018 and, this morning, the ball was deflated quite a bit. I pumped it up and it continues to lose air (although I don't know where). This ball has been carefully treated and only used in front of my desk for 3-4 hours a day. I really liked the product until this morning and now I have just wasted quite a bit of money on equipment that does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Creating Purpose, LLC

customer_reviews.title: If you suffer from low back pain, BUY THIS CHAIR!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered with spinal problems for 17 years along with SI joint pain and severe arthritis. I also sit at a desk for 8 hours a day and have struggled with the pain on a daily basis. If you have similar issues as I do, you NEED to BUY THIS CHAIR!!!! I cannot explain why or how it works but I am telling you that I am a changed woman. I haven't had to take pain medication during the day since the first day I used it. It is truly a miracle chair and I wish I had known about it much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would prefer some upgrades
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty sturdy chair, easy to assemble, and helpful in reducing pain. Not easy to maintain a full ball after blowing up when trying to insert stopper; wheels keep locking on their own; and it’s a little lower than I would like and I’m only 5’8”
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Core Strength
customer_reviews.text: I am now over the age of sixty. And, while I don't "feel" old, I am determined to remain safe from falls. The Giam Ball Chair has helped me to strengthen my abdominal muscles which insures that my balance is improved and that I am getting a "mini" workout each time I use it. I would recommend it to anyone who wishes to maintain a health balance and improve their overall well-being.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Koon

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but double check height of chair and desk
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and I was really hoping it would work for me! However, this chair is super low, and totally unusable anywhere in my house. I wish the height was adjustable...but turns out I need the bigger size. However, from measuring the larger size, that will be too big! In the meantime, I use just the Gaiam seat cusion and LOVE it - my back hasn't felt this great in years!
customer_reviews.author: Jlrvs69

customer_reviews.title: Love how you get all the benefits of sitting on ...
customer_reviews.text: Love how you get all the benefits of sitting on an exercise ball while also maintaining the functionality of an office chair with the wheels on the bottom. Only thing missing is the arm rests, oh and don't try leaning back (I think the package mentions this also) because it won't support your weight, it's more of a handle to grab and move the chair around. I took one star off because air will leak out of the ball (very slowly, but still) meaning you have to pump it up again every week or two. Nothing major but make sure you hold onto the pump and don't throw it away!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Park

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easy to assemble! I actually didn't buy into claims of core strength, I was simply buying it because it looked like it would be more comfortable than a standard chair following a tailbone injury (it is). I was surprised to find that it does seem to help with my abs and posture. The wasabi color is great! I was afraid it would be tacky, but the color is light enough that it's just bright and pretty. I am only 5'2 and it's perfectly comfortable! I was a little concerned that it wouldn't work well because I'm short, but that isn't the case.
customer_reviews.author: StephSchiff

customer_reviews.title: Was sent a ball that is way too small
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this. I followed the instructions here on Amazon to inflate to ball, wait 24 hours, half deflate, and then reinflate again. I got it Thursday, followed the above process on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. As you can see from my picture, it doesn't match any of the pictures provided by Gaiam. I got out the ruler and the ball I was given only inflates to 16.5 inches when the instructions say it should inflate to 21.5 inches. I've reached out to Gaiam support and will update this review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: TwitchyKitten

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chair for people with back issues
customer_reviews.text: I am going to rate this chair as really good. I received my ball chair in 2 days as promised. Packaging was intact and all required parts were included. A small issue is the holes in the base unit that hold the support bar. They are slightly smaller than the metal "K" holders that are supposed to fit in them. I cleaned the holes out with a pair of scissors to allow the metal pieces to fit in snuggly. I would buy this chair again, as it has been extremely helpful in reducing sciatic and back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great for my back
customer_reviews.text: Got this as I have a bad back and was looking for a way to not make matters worse while at work. This has definitely helped my posture and I'm having less back pain generally. When I first received this I thought the wrong size ball was included, however I followed the directions about filling it up and waiting 24 hours, then removing some air and filling again. It took a few days but the ball did expand to the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for working on your core.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this chair on the recommendation of our son's ABA therapist so as to help him work on his core. The chair does just that. You are sitting on an inflated ball that is soft and conformable to sit on, but forces you to sir upright, and prevents slouching. Our Don has been using it for a few weeks now, and his therapists definitely sees an improvement. So if core strength is your goal to develop this chair can help you with that, as well as being fun to bounce and sit on. Get it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Papoutsis

customer_reviews.title: Just as pictured
customer_reviews.text: People posting bad reviews simply put the chair together incorrectly.their picture show the back on backwards. You have to inflate the ball twice 24 hours apart, like any other yoga ball. I love it . Works great
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: I will say that it's easy to assemble and also easy to take apart
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a lighter person could sit on this and work productively, but I pumped as much air into the ball as I could manage and I still sank down to nearly a squatting position that was far too low to use with my average-height desk. I will say that it's easy to assemble and also easy to take apart, it's got that going for it.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I think this was made for a nine year old. Seriously, my nine year old fits it better than I do. He's 5 feet and eighty pounds. Me, at 5'6 and 170 pounds...not so much. The ball is tiny, and the base for the ball to sit on not much bigger. Unless you sit at an unusually short desk, this won't work for you. And even if it did fit your desk, it feels like you're sitting in a child's chair at their school. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: LBell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and back-saving!
customer_reviews.text: I have this same chair in my office, so had to get one for home with this whole shelter-in-place/remote work thing. Very comfortable - so much better than sitting on a flat, traditional chair!!! No lower back pain, and comes with an exercise sheet.
customer_reviews.author: FrauHaas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I would never recommend this product to anybody. Ever since I bought two of these yoga ball chairs, I have had problems. One of the balls that arrived was a completely different size from the other and compared to the chair it was supposed to fit in. The ball recently began losing air for no reason after 6 months of use and the product support I received was terrible. Don't but this product if you ever plan on sitting and actually using the chair to work because if you experience any problems the customer service will do nothing to help!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Almost Worth 3 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I only have three quips about this product, which I will list below: 1. Inflation: The included air pump did not include required tip for insertion into the ball in order to inflate it. Fortunately, I had one lying around. 2. Metal Retaining Ring/Handle: There are a pair of cams which get threaded on to the base of metal handle/retaining ring in front of the ball. The holes on the plastic base where the cams get inserted, were too small. I pulled out my trusty tap kit and fixed that in no time. 3. This chair sits lower than I expected, and it causes me a bit of discomfort in the hip flexors.
customer_reviews.author: tjenk0911

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have only good experience, but one suggestion. There is a trigger near the wheels, where the wheels can be locked....yeah, they are so sensitive they get locked with the smallest touch. I can even do some exercise on it. my back pain is gone! seriously! I used to sit on an office chair like I used to be a teenager ( very bad position ) so with this product, it has corrected my posture. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: AlexiosFini

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for core exercises and to avoid slouching at work
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using my Gaiam chair when working at my computer and art desks. As the directions say, it may need to be reinflated a few times at first, but then holds the air longer. Adding a little air is a quick and easy job. The chair rolls very easily, which isn't necessarily an advantage on a hard floor, because it's easy to bump it while sitting down. I also like the backrest, to provide a little support to avoid losing my balance. I use an inflated stability disc on another hard chair, but the Gaiam ball chair is more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskaguy

customer_reviews.title: I have a bad back. After using this chair for three months
customer_reviews.text: The ball had a leak, so I had to replace it. The back support can support hardly any weight at all and will bend if you lean on it. The front metal bar eventually snapped. It's difficult to move in, despite the wheels. I have fallen off of the chair twice, as the ball has a tendency to "pop out" sending the chair flying backwards and your butt onto the floor. I have a bad back. After using this chair for three months, 5-12 hours a day, I have noticed zero difference in my back or overall comfort.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: The chair is sensational for keeping me sitting up straight ...
customer_reviews.text: The chair is sensational for keeping me sitting up straight at my work desk. However I purchased the chair on June 5, 2015 and the metal retaining bar on the front broke on August 19, 2015. Since the return policy is minimal, the item is no longer eligible for return or replacement. Therefore, my review is guarded. Right now I will just remove the retaining bar and continue to use the chair hoping that I don't roll off the base and lose all dignity!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper #1

customer_reviews.title: beware - does tip back - significant injury risk
customer_reviews.text: I love Gaiam so hesitated to write this - but I feel I should warn people just in case it is a concern for others - I rolled this chair back and it tipped backward and I fell off and seriously tore my MCL. I like to think I am a decently fit and active middle aged female (yoga, paddleboard etc.) so not prone to injury or balance issues. And, it may have been a freak accident. However, I would say to any potential purchasers be careful with this chair, and if you are in any risk group probably not an ideal option.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey F-S

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth it
customer_reviews.text: THIS CHAIR ROCKS. I can sit at my desk for over 10 hours a day (i have an intense school schedule this semester) and my back will not hurt at all! Prior to buying this chair, i constantly was complaining about my back and neck hurting. Also, it helps with focus and productivity if you have ADHD, this wiggling in this chair decreases your chances of losing focus.. atleast with me it has! 10/10 recommend. Just follow the instructions when setting it up. You have to inflate the ball, deflate it in 24 hours, then inflate it again to safely blow it up to its full diameter.
customer_reviews.author: krystal

customer_reviews.title: No more hip and knee pain
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this chair for a week and love, love, love it. I had been having stiffness in my hips and legs when I got up from my very expensive office chair of late and thought I would try this out based on a few people who had them. It's is amazing. From day one and now still, no issues, and I find that I sit up straighter on this baby.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to sit on and moves easy.
customer_reviews.text: This was referred by a customer and I have been using it for a week now and I love it. I tried a regular balance ball for my desk but I rotate between my desk and my computer and I had to physically get off the ball and move it from one desk to the other. The chair rolls easily. The only thing is the chair is made of lightweight plastic so it seemed kind of cheap, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Dinana

customer_reviews.title: I'm very into this
customer_reviews.text: If it's the right height for your desk, it is really awesome. It forces you to keep your core engaged throughout the work day but it's not insanely hard. If you get tired, there is a small back rest. I like bouncing while working. I noticed a difference in my shoulders from better posture. However, the second job I took this to, the desk was too low and it put too much strain on my wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Don't Fall for this Crap! I did twice! TOTAL GARBAGE !
customer_reviews.text: Good idea. Bad design! Unstable. Can kick out and make you fall hard and fast backwards!!! Going to fix dangerous design or return ! Not using this unstable chair again this way! Fell twice got hurt and destroyed two headsets. I am Very unsatisfied!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Trag

customer_reviews.title: but she gave me her ball and it is fine the height is perfect
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one of these a few months back and our receptionist really likes it so I ordered this one for myself. Same product but different color ball and what we received was a ball so small I could not use it to sit at regular desk height. We were not sure if it just needed to be sat on awhile for it to expand, but she gave me her ball and it is fine the height is perfect. She is going to sit on the one just ordered to see if it expands and can be brought up to proper size as the company told her to try this.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

product_meta.title: Gaiam Classic Balance Ball Chair – Exercise Stability Yoga Ball Premium Ergonomic Chair for Home and Office Desk with Air Pump, Exercise Guide and Satisfaction Guarantee
product_meta.description:
This revolutionary desk chair will change the way you sit. Designed with a work-life balance in mind, the Gaiam Balance Ball Chair, created with the help of chiropractic pioneer Dr. Randy Weinzoft, provides the all-day ergonomic support needed while sitting for long duration. Feel better at your workplace by utilizing this alternative chair solution that encourages wellness and helps to soothe the aches and pains that come from sitting at a desk for extended periods of time. By promoting micro movements and constant stimulation of the body, the mind will experience a heightened sense of focus and concentration. This unique office desk chair is designed for users between 5' - 5'11" and fits most standard size desks. For users that may require a little extra boost, the Gaiam Leg Extenders add 2 inches of height to your chair. Please note that for the ball to fit perfectly in the base, it may be necessary to re-inflate the ball once or twice after initial inflation. 

Includes:
- 1 Classic yoga ball (52cm) that can be taken out of the chair base and used separately for exercises. 
- 4 Easy-glide caster wheels (2 lockable) 
- 1 Adjustable metal support bar 
- 1 Air pump 
- 1 Desk chair exercise guide for activating your sit in the home or office 

Gaiam is a leading lifestyle brand with a mission to make yoga, fitness, and well-being accessible to all. Gaiam was created as a lifestyle company with the vision that, given a choice, people would choose a lifestyle that is healthy and life enhancing, for themselves, their families and the Earth. The Gaiam wellness, yoga, meditation, and recovery lifestyle is a vote for individual health as well as the future sustainability of the Earth's resources. Gaiam strives to provide customers with alternatives to traditional products by offering natural or healthy versions that compare with the style, quality and price of conventional products.
feature_bullets: ALTERNATIVE DESK CHAIR: Created by health and fitness experts to improve overall well-being and provide an active flexible seating outlet that promotes proper alignment and relives back pain and soreness associated with sitting for long periods of time

BOOST ENERGY & FOCUS: Micro-movements from sitting on a balance ball chair work to engage the body and mind, leading to higher energy levels and increased productivity and focus at home, in the classroom at school or at your desk in the office

RECOMMENDED USER HEIGHT: Designed for users 5 feet to 5 feet 11 inches tall and fits most standard height desks. For a taller chair, add 2 inches with the Gaiam Leg Extenders (Sold Separately) Weight Capacity = 300lbs

BALL CHAIR INCLUDES: Removable 52cm Exercise Ball, Chair Base, Support Bar, Metal Ball Holder, 4 Easy-Glide Caster Wheels (2 lockable), Air Pump, Desktop Exercise Guide (Minor Assembly/Setup Required – see packaging for details) Weight = 13lbs.

INFLATION NOTICE: It may be necessary to re inflate the ball after initial inflation to allow the ball’s material to stretch to its final size. Inflate ball with air, let stand for 24 hours, deflate 50%, then fill again to 52cm height

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
